intro: Eragrostis aristata, commonly known as the spikegrass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family, Poaceae. It is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and dense clusters of spike-like inflorescences that give it its common name. Its leaves are narrow and often covered with fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its dry habitat. Eragrostis aristata is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental appearance and ability to withstand drought conditions.
